artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Hayashiya Shōgorō; Carver: Yokogawa Takejirō
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: portrait of a frowning man with mouth slightly open; bare arms visible at edges of sheet; man wears a kimono with white stripes with brown brushstroke-like marks and purple stripes with blue checks; sword handle visible at man's stomach; landscape at top with mountain at left and trees; red cartouche with text in URC, surrounded by blossoming trees, lantern with text, bench and other objects
markings: date seal: 子十一 {ne jūichi} (Rat 11) | censor seals: 渡邊 {Watanabe} | 米良 {Mera} | publisher\'s seal: {Rinshō ban} | carver\'s seal: {hori Take}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Sixty-nine Stations along the Kiso Highway (Kiso rokujūkyū tsugi 木曽六十九驛)
signed: in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga}
title: Kanno River at Shingawa Station [sic; Kanna River at Shinmachi Station]: (Actor Nakamura Gizaemon as) Ohyariko Denbei
